New Records: Virat Kohli recorded his first international hundred in nearly three years.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar bowled one of the best spells in Twenty20 cricket by grabbing 5-4.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli hit a blistering unbeaten 122 off just 61 balls.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar's brilliant swing bowling upfront resulted in Afghanistan reaching 111-8.
India achieved a massive 101-run win over Afghanistan.
Rahul and Kohli provided India a rollicking start of 119 runs off 76 balls.
Kohli smacked both Afghanistan pace bowlers Fareed Ahmad and Fazalhaq Farooqi in the death overs.
Kohli raised his maiden T20 century in the penultimate over by hitting left-arm fast bowler Ahmed for a boundary.
Kohli dedicated his century to his wife Anushka Sharma and their daughter Vamika.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed that he batted out of his skin and surprised himself.
Afghanistan skipper Mohammad Nabi conceded that the team was not mentally prepared and dropped some catches.
Kohli mentioned that six weeks off allowed him to enjoy the game again.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India bowed out of the Asia Cup with this win.
Afghanistan faltered in the Super 4 stage, losing all three of its games.
India couldn't make it to the final after losing to Pakistan and Sri Lanka.
